input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):rejected by Prof. Miracle Abshire (3):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire (4):work in progress by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: It is the manufacturers recommendation that the East Powerhouse ACB's are maintained as they are 5 years old
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend CBRE office for induction and sign relevant paperwork
All switching to be completed by CBRE
Handover ACB to contractor to carry out maintenace as follows
Air Circuit Breakers
- Full 20 Point mechanical service.
- All Coils / Accessories functionality and impedance checked – where possible.
- Moving / Arcing contacts cleaned / inspected. Contact wear and arcing contact gaps measured
and recorded.
- Protection Release injected at multiple thresholds. All trip times verified against manufacturer’s
tripping curves.
- 30 Mechanical service operations carried out.
- Fixed Portion cleaned and subject to 10 Point inspection.
- Mechanical interlock visually inspected for set up and functionality.
- ACB low Ohm continuity (10A) and insulation resistance (500v) tested.
- Successful re-instatement.
Restore ACB to normal service
Sign off relevant paperwork
scope_of_work.justification: It is the manufacturers recommendation that the East Powerhouse ACB's are maintained as they are 5 years old. Maintenance can reduce the risk of failure of parts resulting in possible outage on the UPS system which will in turn affect the IT load
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Maintenance can reduce the risk of failure of parts resulting in possible outage on the UPS system which will in turn affect the IT load

The defined scope of work includes: Attend CBRE office for induction and sign relevant paperwork

Handover ACB to contractor to carry out maintenace as follows

- Full 20 Point mechanical service.
- All Coils / Accessories functionality and impedance checked – where possible.
- Moving / Arcing contacts cleaned / inspected. Contact wear and arcing contact gaps measured
and recorded.
- Protection Release injected at multiple thresholds. All trip times verified against manufacturer’s
tripping curves.
- 30 Mechanical service operations carried out.
- Fixed Portion cleaned and subject to 10 Point inspection.
- Mechanical interlock visually inspected for set up and functionality.
- ACB low Ohm continuity (10A) and insulation resistance (500v) tested.
- Successful re-instatement.
Restore ACB to normal service
Sign off relevant paperwork. The justification provided is: It is the manufacturers recommendation that the East Powerhouse ACB's are maintained as they are 5 years old. Maintenance can reduce the risk of failure of parts resulting in possible outage on the UPS system which will in turn affect the IT load. If not approved, the effect would be: Maintenance can reduce the risk of failure of parts resulting in possible outage on the UPS system which will in turn affect the IT load.

input.project_name: UPM-Greenford G59/99 set up and DNO witness test
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.scope:
Senior controls engineer attend site for 2 x NWH days to carry out preliminary checks of existing MainsPro protection module settings & familiarise oneself with existing system. 
Investigate original DNO witness issue of Max parallel timer to exceed 60 seconds via adjustments required to existing control system and/or force of system to allow.
Senior controls engineer 1 x NWH day for DNO witness test. 
Specialist engineer to attend site for 2 x NWH days to carry out preliminary checks of existing MainsPro protection module settings & familiarise oneself with existing system. Investigate original DNO witness issue of Max parallel timer to exceed 60 seconds via adjustments required to existing control system and/or force of system to allow.
Specialist engineer to attend site for 1 x NWH day to test existing ComAp Mains
pro relays for G99 short term paralleling using latest G99 test sheet in conjunction
with DNO attendance and witness test.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
During a recent Inergen Gas System Service visit to your Site, our 
Engineer has prescribed the following that requires further 
attention.
Unable to carry out the Service of the Inergen System due to the 
Panel being water damaged, this needs to be replaced. Also 2 
Weatherproof and one normal Status Units need to be replaced. 

Mains needs to be re-wired by Site Engineers
scope_of_work.scope:
Damaged Inergen panel will need proving dead, then outgoing circuits identified and labelled up then disconnected. Once disconnected the damaged panel can be removed. New Inergen panel can then be installed and existing circuits reconnected and then re energised and tested.
2 weatherproof units and 1 normal unit for status indication also require replacing which can be done as the panel is disconnected.

on site team will also pull in new circuit from DB to fire panel spur and then test before panel is energised.
scope_of_work.justification: If the Damaged panel is not replaced we will have no fire suppression cover throughout CSD3 Switchroom. This could result in a loss of switchgear as in a fire situation we would have no means of dowsing the flames, this could result in major loss of out going circuits and equipment around the site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: If the Damaged panel is not replaced we will have no fire suppression cover throughout CSD3 Switchroom. This could result in a loss of switchgear as in a fire situation we would have no means of dowsing the flames, this could result in major loss of out going circuits and equipment around the site.

3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: During a recent Inergen Gas System Service visit to your Site, our 
Engineer has prescribed the following that requires further 
attention.
Unable to carry out the Service of the Inergen System due to the 
Panel being water damaged, this needs to be replaced. Also 2 
Weatherproof and one normal Status Units need to be replaced. 

Mains needs to be re-wired by Site Engineers. The defined scope of work includes: Damaged Inergen panel will need proving dead, then outgoing circuits identified and labelled up then disconnected. Once disconnected the damaged panel can be removed. New Inergen panel can then be installed and existing circuits reconnected and then re energised and tested.
2 weatherproof units and 1 normal unit for status indication also require replacing which can be done as the panel is disconnected.

on site team will also pull in new circuit from DB to fire panel spur and then test before panel is energised.. The justification provided is: If the Damaged panel is not replaced we will have no fire suppression cover throughout CSD3 Switchroom. This could result in a loss of switchgear as in a fire situation we would have no means of dowsing the flames, this could result in major loss of out going circuits and equipment around the site.. If not approved, the effect would be: If the Damaged panel is not replaced we will have no fire suppression cover throughout CSD3 Switchroom. This could result in a loss of switchgear as in a fire situation we would have no means of dowsing the flames, this could result in major loss of out going circuits and equipment around the site..
